chargeHist.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Daniel Scot Nabbefeld was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Property Other Than Building

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must obtain and maintain full-time employment.  If enrolled in course of higher education, full-time employment requirement may be relaxed to part-time.
Must submit apologies to victims in way and manner to be determined by agent.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Jail term is to commence within 60 days from 01-09-15.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 am - 14CF74 & 140FO218 - Defendant Daniel Scot Nabbefeld appeared with attorney David Deda.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed.  DA states agreement.  Waiver of preliminary hearing form is provided to Court.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  DE waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver is given freely and accepts.  Parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Cts. 1-3 of the information.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Comments by parties.  Comments and ruling by Court.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC deferred for a period of 2 years on Ct. 1 and orders entry of JOC on Cts. 2 & 3.  Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:05 am.  
Court imposes:
14FO218 - Dismissed on motion of DA.
14CF74:
Ct. 1 - Deferred - 2 years.  See written order.
Ct. 2 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation.  Conditions:  30 day jail term, with huber privileges, to commence within 60 days from 01-09-15; $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS; Apologies; AODA; Rest. $1015 + 10% surcharge of $101.5 = $1116.50, Joint & Several; Must obtain and maintain full-time employment.  If enrolled in course of higher education, full-time employment requirement may be relaxed to part-time.  
Ct. 3 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation.  Conditions:  $243 court costs; remainder of the conditions are the same as Ct. 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 9, 2015 at 09:30 am.

10:11 am - DE does not appear.  Attorney David Deda appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned until 10-21-14 at 10:00 am.  Adj. 10:12 am.  DE now appears at 10:13 am.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.    Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.  Adj. 10:14 am.
Search warrant; application and affidavit; return of officer

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not consume alcohol, controlled substances and no prescription medications, unless prescribed to him and in the manner prescribed.  NO CONTACT with Crista Hoefs or Melissa LaPlaca, nor go upon any residence in which they reside now or in the future.
